intro: Collinsonia scabriuscula, commonly known as roughleaf collinsonia, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Stellariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in well-drained soil. Its foliage is often covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is valued in native plant gardens for its ornamental qualities and ecological benefits.
